Any Developer. Any App. Any Platform. Microsoft continues to make big investments to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. The Developer Division at Microsoft creates modern tools & services that help developers build apps & services for a variety of platforms, including Windows, iOS, Android, Azure - Microsoft’s cloud, and many more.   

 

The Developer Division builds developer tools (Visual Studio & Visual Studio Code), and designs & develops compilers & runtimes for C#, Java, TypeScript (JavaScript), C++ and Python. In a 2018 survey done by stackoverflow.com, Visual Studio & Visual Studio Code were the top 2 most popular development environments & tools.

 

Our tools help a wide spectrum of developers all the way from professional developers to middle school students. We create solutions together in a rich, collaborative environment, and while we work hard together, work/life balance and having fun are also core values. Make your mark, learn about a wide array of technologies, make an impact, and make our customers the most successful and productive developers in the world!

 

Within the Developer Division, the Java Engineering Group at Microsoft is responsible for building best-in-class support for Java workloads running on Azure (Microsoft’s Cloud) and other products from the Microsoft family, such as Mojang’s Minecraft Java Edition and LinkedIn. We work on OpenJDK (including the Java Virtual Machine), tune Java workloads at a massive scale, build insightful performance diagnostic tooling, and act as both the center of excellence for Java within Microsoft and as a liaison between Microsoft and the wider Java ecosystem.

 

Our Java VM Engineering team is looking for a Software Engineer 2 who has a passion for learning new technologies, interacting with colleagues and customers, and a strong desire to make the work of Java runtime users and developers more productive, satisfying, and enjoyable.  

 

Day-to-day activities include interaction with a large variety of customers both inside and outside Microsoft, partner teams, and a wide array of technologies, including of course Java and Azure. Our code is written using many languages and frameworks, with C++, Java, assembly, and Python being the most common.

 

If you are interested in growing your engineering career, there is no better place to start!

DevDiv (Visual Studio, .NET, Microsoft Dev Box, Azure App Service & Redis Cache, and more!) is looking for a Product Manager to help us improve the developer experiences for everyone using any language. In DevDiv we are on a mission to change how developers think about the developer workstation from a long running carefully curated physical device to an ephemeral resource, powered by cloud services, that’s personalized to each developer and can scale to build and debug any application of any size. 

 

Estimates are that the global population of developers will be 45 million in 2030.  That’s an increase of 18 million developers from today.  Each of these developers brings with them ideas and innovations that they’d like to share with the world.  They need world-class products, services, and tooling that enable them to seamlessly move from idea to code to cloud.  

 

About the Role 

 

DevDiv is looking for a Product Manager (PM) interested in helping to achieve this vision and improve the developer experiences for everyone using any language.  This role is best suited for a PM who is passionate about technology, thoughtfully analytical in understanding customer requirements and competitive context, and eager to drive tangible business impact in a collaborate team. You will need to collaborate across organizations to ensure extraordinary experiences across tools, cloud hosting, and customer outreach. Technical proficiency and problem solving are must haves to understand customer pain points and communicate effectively with the development team. Your role will require making decisions regarding trade-offs and challenges with app development so previous experience in developer tools would be beneficial. 

 

About Us 

 

Microsoft’s Developer Division (“DevDiv”) is chartered with empowering every developer and every development team on the planet to build great software faster.  We build developer platforms, tools and services to enable anyone from citizen developers to seasoned professional developers to be successful in realizing their software’s potential from local to cloud development.  We also build cloud services optimized for running developer workloads in the cloud, such as Azure Functions, Azure Container Apps and Azure App Services.  These tools and services play a critical role in the success of platforms and solutions ensuring that developers can be productive, work how and where they want, and have reliable and high performance set of tools at their disposal.  The tools we build are the Visual Studio family (Visual Studio, Visual Studio for Mac, Visual Studio Code), IntelliCode, runtimes (.NET and Java), compilers, SDKs, languages, testing platforms/tools, package management, and critical developer services to help deliver these experiences. 

 

This is a remote friendly team, but we would be happy to offer a hybrid work experience as well!

Do you love Visual Studio?

 

Do you love showing developers how to be more productive using the world’s best developer tools?

 

Do you love creating extensions for Visual Studio? A career as a Community Manager inside of Microsoft’s Developer Division may be for you! 

 

As a Senior Product Manager focusing on Visual Studio community management, you will be responsible for managing the “Story of Visual Studio.” This means you will be working across all teams to build our roadmap, documentation, learning content, and processes to communicate the value of Visual Studio to customers. We need your help to help build a strong community around Visual Studio by creating vibrant and relevant content, engaging with developer communities, and unlocking unique opportunities to highlight how Visual Studio can help developers be more productive.  

 

Does this sound like you? 

 

  • You build apps and libraries with Visual Studio in your spare time just for fun. 
  • You have a passion for .NET, C++, Python, and Azure platforms 
  • You have a love for teaching others about new things and love learning from others. 
  • You enjoy giving technical talks and presentations.  
  • You blog about your technical escapades and discoveries. 
  • You participate in online communities like GitHub, Twitter, Stack Overflow, and Hacker News. 
  • You attend hackathons and meetups to build new things and network with other people. 
  • You keep up with new technologies, trying many of them out for yourself. 
  • You enjoy meeting new and different people from around the world. 

 

If you regularly do many of these activities, you'll enjoy being a PM, VS Community Manager on the Developer Community Team at Microsoft!  

 

Join our 100% remote-first & friendly team to help empower developers around the world! Our team has been fully remote since we were formed and you can be too, or if you prefer to work from an office that is great too!

Microsoft's Developer Division looking for a Principal UX Researcher with CS ED (Computer Science Education) expertise to join the team. In this role, you will play a crucial role in ensuring that human insight – both at the individual and market level – is at the center of our education strategy, improving the value students/professors find in our offerings, and how they feel using them. We aspire to help address retention, diversity, and persistence in computing through programs, partnerships, and products like Visual Studio Code, Visual Studio, GitHub, and Codespaces. Overall, our objective is to help develop a skilled and diverse techforce from the 427M postsecondary students learning computer and data science today.

 

You will be joining a team of ~25 talented UX researchers whose charter is to design end-to-end experiences for developers that are useful, usable, and desirable. You will work in a highly collaborative environment with engineering, design, and business teams across the division to help make customer driven decisions, including directly interfacing with leadership directors and VPs. You need to be able to think big picture, as well as be able to define, articulate, and defend research details with partners. Your work will happen in the context of a lean or agile development environment supporting the release cadence of teams as well as helping define the strategic direction of products.

 

How do people learn computing? What are shortcomings of current tools and how they can be addressed? How can tools for teaching and learning help improve equity? What interventions can IDEs make to boost student confidence? These are the types of questions that fuel our work every day. Join us!
